title.narrative: Urbanising Deltas of the World - Connecting Worlds of Knowledge

description.narrative: The UDW-Connecting Worlds of Knowledge call will contribute to the overall aim of the UDW programme to contribute to global water safety, water and food security and pro-poor sustainable economic and urban development in river deltas worldwide, by providing effective and efficient responses to increasing pressure and rapid changes related to climate change, population growth and increasing economic activities. Furthermore, this call has a specific focus on enhancing the use and translation of UDW research results for innovation and implementation in delta management and strengthening the development and implementation of delta policies and management. The call will contribute to the following specific objectives of the UDW programme: 1. Uptake of research results and application of tools and perspectives for improving institutional and legal frameworks for delta and river basin management, and robust planning techniques and new scenario building methods for decision-making under uncertainty. 2. Improved capacity of organisations, groups and individuals including researchers and policy makers, to influence global water safety, water and food security and sustainable economic development in deltas. 3. New knowledge and insights in use that add value to processes, products, services, technologies, policies or ideas that are made available to markets, governments and society, which enhance the future competitive position of businesses.

mailing-address.narrative: PO Box 93120 2509 AC The Hague The Netherlands

Annual progress report 2020

New knowledge and insights in use that add value to processes, products, services, technologies, policies or ideas that are made available to markets, governments and society, which enhance the future competitive position of businesses
Number of processes, products, services, technologies, policies or ideas altered and used by: - business partners - governments - society
Capacity / skills developed on tools / best practices for enhancing the position and empowerment of the most vulnerable groups
Number of capacity building or training events for stakeholders and end-users
New tools, concepts and ideas tested in a specific governmental, business or community setting
Number of processes, products, services, technologies, policies or ideas tested in a real life situation
Number of end-users involved in pilot projects to apply processes, products, services, technologies or ideas
Information system / data base established and capacities developed to ensure access to different sources of knowledge by stakeholders
Information system / database established with access for stakeholders at different levels
Intensity of use of information system / databases

Contribution to global water safety, water and food security and the sustainable economic development in river deltas worldwide by providing more effective and efficient responses to increasing pressure and rapid changes in these areas
Number of cases with improved water and/or food security
Number of cases of enhanced water safety
Number of changes in socio-economic development indicators (e.g. poverty index, HDI)
Number of social groups living under less vulnerable circumstances

Uptake of research results, tools and perspectives for improving institutional and legal frameworks for delta and river basin management and robust planning techniques and new scenario building methods for decision-making under uncertainty.
Number of local platforms strengthened
Number of end-users applying or adopting tools, practices and policy recommendations by the project
Number of diffused policy recommendations adopted
Business, GO, CSO include research evidence in implementation and innovation
Number of end-users that start adapting services, products and processes
Number of enterprises with an improved marker position
Establishment or strengthening of platforms / partnerships for collaborative and effective sharing of information, with exchange events, at relevant scale and levels
Number of events by platforms / partnerships at regional level to share information and collaborate
Number of exchange visits within consortium and/or with other stakeholder groups

Improved capacity of organizations, groups and individuals, including researchers, policy makers to influence global water safety, water and food security and the sustainable economic development in deltas
Number of stakeholders or end-users with evidence of using skills acquired by involvement in the project or by training
Number of learning platforms / partnerships actively operating at regional level to influence delta management and governance
Relevant contributions to policies, policy processes or plans analyzed, and policy recommendations developed
